attributes.action: Boris Johnson must now resign based on the results of the vote of no confidence
attributes.background:
Boris Johnson has lost support for 41% of his back benchers, history shows that this is not sustainable for a Prime Minister. 

For the good of the country, Boris Johnson should now resign.
attributes.additional_details: The will of the general public is for Boris Johnson to resign. He should either resign or allow the public to have their say on the matter.

rejection.details:
We can't accept petitions about appointments, which includes calling for Ministers to be sacked or for a vote of no confidence.

If you're concerned about a particular policy or decision that's the responsibility of Government or the House of Commons, you could start a petition about that.

attributes.action: No New Nuclear
attributes.background:
Nuclear power is not the solution.
It contributes to warming and 
creates waste like nothing else.

Be it small modular reactors (SMR), or large plants, it is not the answer.

Nuclear, like fossil fuels, funds mining that harms indigenous folks outside the UK. Out of sight out of mind, right?
attributes.additional_details:
Nuclear plants (inc SMRs), are unsuitable in our changing climate. They’re ineffective/forced to close during heatwaves.

Plants will face ever frequent flooding. Imagine nuclear waste entering our seas as a result. The public and planet lose out.

Investing heavily in nuclear deflects from (cleaner/greener) renewables.

We urge the Government to rethink the introduction of new nuclear, and to include a ‘No New Nuclear’ clause in all climate planning.

No new nuclear. Fund ✨sustainable✨ power.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about new nuclear plants, but we're not sure if you want the Government to ban new nuclear plants, or just not provide funding for new nuclear power generation.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Introduce the 50+1 model of fan ownership in English football
attributes.background: The attempt by six Premier League football clubs to create a "European Super League" demonstrates how that the current model of English football club ownership is broken. The owners of these clubs are more interested in short-term profit than fair competition or the good of football generally.
attributes.additional_details:
Whilst the English clubs have abandoned this project, it highlights the need for change. The current "cash is king" culture is not sustainable. 

We demand that the Government legislates to protect these community assets from predatory owners and introduces the 50+1 ownership model used in Germany. 

Further information about the 50+1 fan ownership model used in Germany is available here: https://www.bundesliga.com/en/news/Bundesliga/german-soccer-rules-50-1-fifty-plus-one-explained-466583.jsp

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/583310

You may be interested to know that on 19 April the Government announced a 'Fan-led review of football governance', which will explore ways of improving the governance, ownership and financial sustainability of clubs in English football, building on the strengths of the football pyramid. You can read more about this review here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/fan-led-review-of-football-governance.

attributes.action: Bring about charges and/or control people earning money for being uneconomical
attributes.background: Make a law that increases tax bands or brings about charges against people being purposely uneconomical for entertainment. E.g. Someone hits a hammer on a TV screen for entertainment on social media. This would support the new law against manufacturers having to provide parts upto 10yrs.
attributes.additional_details: For the people, for the economy, for sustainability, for the environment, to control the media and to prevent antisocial personality traits and for our future.

rejection.details: What people choose to do with their legally-owned possessions within the confines of the law is a matter for them, not the UK Government or Parliament.

attributes.action: Hold a vote of no confidence in Boris Johnson and his government.
attributes.background: This government has continually acted too late to stop the spread of covid-19. We have the worst case numbers in Europe and the NHS is under sustained pressure after years of underfunding. Closing schools after 1 day was the final straw for parents and teachers. Something must change now.
attributes.additional_details: 2,836,805 confirmed cases of covid in the UK today (WHO data: https://covid19.who.int)

rejection.details:
We can't accept petitions about appointments, which includes calling for Ministers to be sacked or for a vote of no confidence.

If you're concerned about a particular policy or decision that's the responsibility of Government or the House of Commons, you could sign or start a petition about that.

attributes.action: Give refunds for practical university courses
attributes.background: Help university students on practical courses to get partial or full refunds for our courses. We can't learn sufficiently online but are paying full price for an incomplete course.
attributes.additional_details: Lots of our money goes towards access to equipment on campus that we now can't access so paying for this still is a waste of money. While the arts are seemingly being pushed aside we need support to get through this. Arts benefit the economy greatly and have so much value and we need it to be sustained. Help us to be able to afford this and any extra teaching we may need after possibly incomplete courses.

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petition:

Require universities to refund for practical courses year 20/21 due to COVID-19
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/562378

attributes.action: Protect our population. Prevent risk of covid spread from immigration.
attributes.background: Our population is at risk.  Many will die if we do not take action to prevent entry to our Country from immigrants who may or may not be carrying covid-19.   Furthermore, the drain on benefits due to immigration is not sustainable in a struggling economy.
attributes.additional_details: Our welfare system must support our residents who have paid into it through National Insurance payments for years.  Many citizens are at risk of unemployment and now may need to draw up on the benefit system.  We can not afford to allow entry to our country at this time and pay for immigrants to be provided with homes, food, clothing, etc., when they have never paid into the benefits system and are very unlikely to in present circumstances.

rejection.details:
We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. The Government has already announce a quarantine period for people entering the UK to reduce the risk of transmisison of Covid-19.  We could publish a petition calling for the UK Goverment to close the borders to all travellers, if that's what you'd like to see happen. 

We could also accept a petition on changes to the benefit system, but we'd need to know which entitlements you'd like to be removed. You can find out more here:

https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/research-briefings/sn06847/

attributes.action: Restore civil liberties to UK citizens and remove all lockdown related laws
attributes.background: The UK has created new legislation (Coronavirus Act 2020) to enforce the lockdown of UK citizens in response to the Covid-19 outbreak in 2020. We believe this legislation and response is infringing on the civil liberties and freedom of UK citizens within our democracy and is highly disproportionate.
attributes.additional_details:
•	The Coronavirus Act of 2020 should be repealed immediately, including all laws and mandates related to lockdown enforcement.
•	The UK should restore civil liberties and freedoms to its citizens.
•	The UK should look to implement a sustainable national strategy like Sweden to combat the virus.
•	The UK should continue to protect older people (60 and over), and those who are clinically vulnerable, and allow them to shield themselves should they choose to (i.e. recommended, but not enforced).

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/313310

attributes.action: Introduce mandatory sustainability indicators on food and product packaging
attributes.background: Due to increased pressures regarding biodiversity decline and loss of natural habitats, the government should pass law that supermarkets and product manufacturers display how sustainable their products are on the packaging. This could be in the form of an additional traffic light style guide.
attributes.additional_details:
Unless we act fast and educate the general public in an accessible and digestible way, we're going to run out of time and see the collapse of the natural living world. Such a small change to how food and consumer products are presented could have a dramatic, positive impact to consumer behaviour. 

Not only would the additional indicators hugely benefit our environment, they'd be likely to have positive economic impacts due to local UK products being favourable over unsustainable import goods.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/549844

attributes.action: Discuss Mercy for Animal's Report on US chickens boiled/frozen alive
attributes.background:
Speak to Mercy For Animals CEO regarding this report

This is the report - https://mercyforanimals.org/slaughterhouses-boiling-animals-alive-freezing

Seeing as UK will be importing US chickens, we want you to speak to Mercy for Animals CEO about the findings in this report.
attributes.additional_details: Speak to Mercy For Animals USA about their report on freezing/boiling alive  chickens to learn more details of their findings.   Its important you understand the details of the report to see if they are true. Because if true, then US welfare may not match UK Animal Welfare Standards. Also UK Gov are supposed to be advocates for UN Sustainable Agriculture in the UN #SDGS so it woud not be good to import chickens with poor welfare.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand you're concerned about animal welfare, but we're not sure exactly what change you'd like the Government or Parliament to make. 
	
You might like to sign this petition:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/326837

attributes.action: The Crown Estate to forego any income from renewable energy projects in the UK.
attributes.background: The British monarch receives 25% of all profits from the Crown Estate. With the expanding renewable energy sector, mainly offshore wind farms, the monarch will receive a windfall of 10's of millions of pounds from green energy license sales. This money should be used to fund green energy projects.
attributes.additional_details:
Offshore Wind Sector Deal
The government will work collaboratively with the sector and wider stakeholders to ensure that up to 30GW of offshore wind can be delivered by 2030.

The Crown Estate and Crown Estate Scotland will undertake new seabed leasing in 2019, ensuring a sustainable pipeline of new projects for the late 2020s and early 2030s. 

www.gov.uk/government/publications/offshore-wind-sector-deal/offshore-wind-sector-deal

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. The Crown Estate's income, including from offshore wind, is returned to the Treasury.  The Sovereign Grant is calcualted as 25% of the income from two years previously. We're not sure whether you want to reduce the size of the Sovereign Grant or stop the collection of any income.
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Ban disposable barbecues.
attributes.background: Ban disposable barbecues, these are a huge cause of forest fires and they are creating a litter problem. This is having an effect on our environment and is damaging our ever so important eco system.
attributes.additional_details: Our woodlands and forests are important and need to be protected. Trees provide so much for nature, they help to protect our environment and are important towards sustaining life on this planet.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/315762

attributes.action: Stop the illegal immigrants crossing the channel
attributes.background: This constant flow of illegal immigrants must stop ...stop all benefits and housing completely for illegal immigrants and send them back immediately from whence they came
attributes.additional_details: This country cannot sustain the amount of illegals crossing the channel daily

rejection.details:
Under international law, it is legal for a person to apply for asylum in any country that has signed the 1951 Geneva Convention and to remain there until the authorities have assessed their claim. 

You could start a new petition asking the UK Government to withdraw from international treaties that give people the right to seek asylum in the UK, if that's what you'd like to happen.

attributes.action: Tax reliefs for SMEs & larger Companies who use Micro-entities & SE as suppliers
attributes.background:
Offer specific and easily accessible Tax reliefs to Companies which are defined as Small, Medium, or large, in return for them using Micro-entities and the Self-employed (SE) in thier supply chain.

(Company sizes as defined in the Companies Act 2006, c46, Pt 15, Ch 1.)
attributes.additional_details:
This will boost the UK economy & make it more resilient by stimulating the movement of cash.

Govt support on starting a business has made doing so easier.  The real struggle is growing to a sustainable size, because Micro-entities & the SE mostly deal with similar sized businesses; meaning access to a very limited pool of cash.  Micro entities can often provide much better value to clients, which means everyone benefits through competition & innovation and distribution of wealth via enterprise.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Free parking & accommodation in UK cities for NHS workers during COVID-19 crisis
attributes.background: We in the NHS are willing to fight this COVID-19 crisis head on. However in major cities it's hard and risky to get around. Our priority is to stay virus free and continue working. Free parking and a place to stay if members of our household need to self isolate would make this much easier.
attributes.additional_details: So we can continue to sustain key NHS services and work safely, minimising risk to patients and each other.

rejection.details:
Since you started this petition, the Government have announced that they will provide free car parking for all NHS and social care staff. You can read more about this here: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/government-to-provide-free-car-parking-for-nhs-and-social-care-staff

You could start a new petition calling on the Government to fund the provision of temporary accommodation for NHS staff during the coronavirus oubtreak.

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/
UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

attributes.action: Create a UK National Week of Respite
attributes.background:
For too long the British public have endured a sustained period of stress, worry and panic.

It started with the Global Financial Crisis in 2008 which led on austerity and has included Scottish independence, Brexit, Climate Change and Coronavirus. 

This is an unprecedented period of time.
attributes.additional_details:
The British public deserve some much needed positivity and I believe Government should lead this with a National Week of Respite possibly held during the Summer Holidays and perhaps repeated each year.

Funds should be provided for festivals, food, drink, fun and events for a week long period during which we celebrate overcoming many challenges and divisions, and get prepared for the ones in future. 

Please help make this a reality by signing this petition. We've all earned it!

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly whether you want the Government to create extra bank holidays, provide funding for events, or a combination of both of these things. 
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Halt the Government's recent moves toward environmental deregulation.
attributes.background: Do not remove regulations, or revise other environmental policies, without a plan for what will replace them. Rather, in line with nature groups open letter to the PM, make haste to strengthen environmental laws, protect nature, and invest in natural infrastructure to support a sustainable economy.
attributes.additional_details:
Proposals within the recent Retained EU Law (Revocation and Reform) Bill and the Planning and Infrastructure Bill will compromise the Government's potential to meet legally-binding 
climate and nature targets, destabilise businesses and long-term sustainability of our economy, and accelerate environmental decline that will have a destructive effect on people and nature. 
The Conservative Government was elected with a commitment to ambitious environmental reforms and is reneging on their promise.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/623839

attributes.action: Inform parliament we have no trust in government to act effectively and fairly
attributes.background: Call a general election
attributes.additional_details: The current government has changed leadership through an internal process and has recently performed in a manner which prejudicial to the sustainable and successful future of society as a whole.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Call an immediate general election to end the chaos of the current government: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/619781

Change the law so that UK citizens can call a General election: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/618068

attributes.action: Consider extending the OZEV EVHS to help more people make the switch to EV.
attributes.background: Extend the OZEV EVHS grant that helps domestic households with a grant of up to £350 towards the installation of an EV charger. The current scheme is due to change at the end of the month, and will only apply to people who live in flats, rented accommodation and businesses.
attributes.additional_details: The cost of fuel in the UK today hit an all-time high with warnings that there is more to come. With the cost of living already putting the country at a crisis point, now is not the time to remove support. In addition, the lack of new cars over the last year has also made this change more difficult. As this starts to ease and pre-ordered cars begin to be delivered, it's only fair that these people should also be able to make use of the grant. Make sustainably affordable.

attributes.action: Prevent Energy Companies being allowed to double the standard charge
attributes.background: The country has been through a pandemic that has caused great hardship to many households/businesses. People are trying to recover from this, and now they are being given another blow not only with NI increase but this massive hike in utility prices.
attributes.additional_details:
The hike in particular is coming in the standing charge some over 50%. This is not sustainable as wages have not increased. A cap needs to be put in place to reduce this. 
Listening to peoples stories is heartbreaking, do we eat, or keep warm.
April is almost here, and then an October price will be issued, this will be horrendous for the winter months. Many people do not want to be paying back £200 for the next 5 years. This has to be looked at in a sensible. Please act now.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is a matter for energy providers.

You can find out more about standing charges here: https://www.energyhelpline.com/help/what-are-unit-rates-and-standing-charges

attributes.action: Stop the double jobbing amendment in the Northern Ireland (MEPOC) Bill.
attributes.background: We do not want another impasse at Stormont. We do not want direct rule and we do not want divide and rule. We need a Westminster petition for this Lords amendment so that it is rejected by the Commons. This move is not consistent with what a vast cross section of the People of Northern Ireland want.
attributes.additional_details: It is going to create more division and instability instead of helping with the sustainability of the Good Friday Agreement Institutions. We need need the diversity of recent surveys to be reflected by our Political Representatives. The People of Northern Ireland would like to collectively make our Society better and more successful through increased Co-operation with our new 3 year budget. We are not a 2 party state. Polarisation is not the answer as we continue with truth and reconciliation.

rejection.details:
The Prime Minster today stated that the amendment known as double jobbing will be withdrawn from the bill.

You can read the question put by Simon Hoare MP and answered by the Prime Minister in the transcript from today's PMQs via the link below:

https://hansard.parliament.uk/commons/2022-01-19/debates/9E134503-624C-465D-870C-DFBCC1A0E4D2/Engagements

attributes.action: Revalue private sector defined benefit pensions to 5% from the current 2.5%
attributes.background: Government should legislate to ensure the CPI cap on revaluation of private sector Defined benefit pensions is increased to 5% from the current 2.5% for employees who have become deferred members through the employer having closed the scheme to future accrual but are still employed by the company
attributes.additional_details: In 2008 government cut the cap from 5% to 2.5% for revaluation of defined benefit pensions in the private sector. The reduction was meant for employees who left the company to go to other jobs. However, since that piece of legislation, swathes of companies have closed DB schemes to future accrual even though the 2017 Government white paper on security sustainability of DB pensions showed many employers could afford these schemes . As we are now entering an inflationary period the government should protect those employees who have stayed with the company but risk erosion of their deferred pension through high inflation which is forecast to hit 4-5 % over the next decade.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about about private sector defined benefit pensions, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to amend the legislation that requires defined pension benefits to be increased in line with inflation, but could not accept a petition calling for the Government to increase the value of all existing pensions, as this is not something the Government is responsible for.

attributes.action: Stop developers building  on areas of outstanding natural beauty (AONB)
attributes.background: Legislate so when a council has no 5 year housing plan, planning approval can not be given where development is in an AONB. This “loophole” needs to be fixed. Brown field sites need to be prioritised and existing planning approvals need to be developed before applications can be considered on AONB
attributes.additional_details: Ensure that areas of outstanding natural beauty are duly protect to create a legacy for future generations to enjoy our countryside, ensure sustainable biodiversity and environmental protection. When for whatever reason a council has no up to date housing development plan developers are exploiting this condition and time and obtaining approval for development on areas of outstanding natural beauty. Putting greed before seed.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about development in Areas of Outstanding Natural Beauty (AONB), but we're not sure if you want all development in these areas to be banned, or just development when the local authority does not have a 5-year housing plan in place.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Review statutory sick pay and increase it
attributes.background: The current weekly rate of SSP is £96.93 a week, this amount is not sustainable with todays cost of living. With the help of benefits this is still not always enough to live off with, if someone is off sick long term.
attributes.additional_details: With the ever increasing cost of living SSP needs to be brought in line to an amount that would actually be livable. Not all those on SSP have savings to help them cope, not all those on SSP will receive the correct benefits to help them.

rejection.details:
We're not sure how much you'd like SSP to be increased by.  You could start a new petition setting out how much you'd like it to increase, or you might like to sign this petition

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/593442

attributes.action: Introduce an independent football regulator and stop the creation of the ESL
attributes.background: Raise the necessary legislation to block the creation of non competitive leagues and other competitions including the proposed ESL. Put an independent regulator in place to ensure football clubs are run in a sustainable manner, root out bad practice and represent all stakeholders.
attributes.additional_details: Clubs throughout the football pyramid are losing significant amounts of money, accumulating debt and not being run in a sustainable manner. The 'elite' club owners are disregarding the traditions of their clubs and supporters. Leveraged debt is being used to purchase clubs and the new owners are able to take huge salaries and consultancy fees. New revenues are ploughed into players salaries which drives the need for additional revenues and ventures such as the ESL.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/584632

attributes.action: Make all packaging recyclable or compostable clearly stating how to dispose it.
attributes.background: We propose a new incentive scheme to get all businesses selling goods to replace all “not yet recycled” packaging with recyclable, recycled, reusable, upcycled or compostable packaging instead. Not only will this tackle the global crisis this has the potential to save a substantial amount of money.
attributes.additional_details: Common plastic packaging contributes to the emission greenhouse gasses into the atmosphere, which contributes further to global warming. Plastic packaging needs to be replaced with sustainable alternatives and clearly state how they should be reused or disregarded. In turn this could help save our planet, save our money and create new jobs. We do not have much time left, we must act now. This is an emergency.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/552450

attributes.action: Freeze business rates for the financial year ending 2022
attributes.background: Most property based businesses have been closed or partially closed for the last twelve months. Rents would have continued to be due and whilst many landlords may have exhibited forbearance during the lockdown, they will expect rent payments to resume, including arrears, once trading commences.
attributes.additional_details: Freezing business rates will enable businesses to use the twelve months post reopening to manage and plan for the onslaught of rent obligations plus arrears placing their business back on an even financial footing. For a typical smaller businesses on low margins and for whom rent and rates make up a major proportion of operating expenses, such an approach will be the difference between financial sustainability or widespread closures and the associated social and economic consequences.

departments.name: Department for Levelling Up, Housing and Communities

attributes.action: Stop children and schools being put under additional pressure, and cancel SATs.
attributes.background: The Education Secretary should cancel SATs this year, to avoid putting schools and children under additional pressure. Teachers’ assessments should only be used for schools to identify needs, share with children and parents and inform the next stage in their education.
attributes.additional_details: Schools and children have faced unprecedented challenges due to Covid. The education secretary, working with the unions and the standards and assessment agency should produce clear criteria for robust assessment of children in core subjects: Maths, Reading and Writing. Teacher assessments should only be used to inform next steps for learning, as children and schools cannot be judged against any norms in the current circumstances, where their education has been interrupted for a sustained period.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/326486

attributes.action: #followthescience! STOP mixing COVID vaccines/START following Pfizer guidelines
attributes.background:
1. STOP permitting the mixing of two different COVID-19 vaccines; and

2. START following the manufacturer's tested and approved spacing of jabs. In the case of the Pfizer vaccine, stop permitting any dosing schedule other than the 21 days recommended, AND TESTED, by the manufacturer.
attributes.additional_details:
1. The Pfizer and AstraZeneca vaccines have not been developed NOR TESTED on the basis that they can be used interchangeably.

2. On 30 December 2020, Pfizer released a statement saying that its vaccine was not intended to be taken 12 weeks apart. It said the vaccine's SAFETY and EFFICACY had not been evaluated on any dosing schedule OTHER THAN 21 DAYS between jabs. It added that "there are NO DATA to demonstrate that protection after the first dose is sustained after 21 days."

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or House of Commons are directly responsible for, and decisions about approval of vaccines and the administration of these is a matter for various public health agencies, not the Government or House of Commons.

We have published the following petition calling for a related action, which you might like to sign: 

Ban vaccines being administered in a manner not fully tested in clinical trials: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/566116

The delays to receiving the second dose of a Covid-19 vaccine has been implemented by the NHS following advice from the Joint Committee on Vaccination and Immunisation (JCVI), which advises UK health departments on immunisation, which has also been supported by the UK's four Chief Medical Officers. Their new advice and the changes to the Covid-19 vaccination programme are consistent with the temporary authorisations granted for these vaccines by the Medicines and Healthcare products Regulatory Agency.

The JCVI, Chief Medical Officers, MHRA and NHS England are all independent and operationally independent of the UK Government, so we cannot accept petitions calling for actions that these bodies are responsible for.

You can read the JCVI's advice on optimising the COVID-19 vaccination programme for maximum short-term impact here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/prioritising-the-first-covid-19-vaccine-dose-jcvi-statement/optimising-the-covid-19-vaccination-programme-for-maximum-short-term-impact

You can read the statement from the UK Chief Medical Officers on the prioritisation of first doses of COVID-19 vaccines here: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/statement-from-the-uk-chief-medical-officers-on-the-prioritisation-of-first-doses-of-covid-19-vaccines

You can read the MHRA's conditions of Authorisation for Pfizer/BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/regulatory-approval-of-pfizer-biontech-vaccine-for-covid-19/conditions-of-authorisation-for-pfizerbiontech-covid-19-vaccine

You can read the MHRA's conditions of Authorisation for COVID-19 Vaccine AstraZeneca here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/regulatory-approval-of-covid-19-vaccine-astrazeneca/conditions-of-authorisation-for-covid-19-vaccine-astrazeneca

attributes.action: Give teachers and school staff priority to rapid Covid testing and vaccinations
attributes.background: Teachers and school staff are highly exposed to the risk of Covid. Recognising the importance of education, the government has kept schools open. In order to sustain the operation of schools, teachers and school staff must have the same priority access to rapid tests and vaccines as NHS staff.
attributes.additional_details:
Covid testing available to school staff is inadequate.  Schools are regularly left with depleted staff whilst availability for tests and results are awaited.  The government must recognise the need to prioritise the availability of rapid tests and vaccinations for teachers and school staff.  Without this, closure of schools due to staff availability will become commonplace.  
  
In order for schools to remain open, rapid tests and vaccinations must be prioritised for teachers and school staff.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Prioritise teachers, school and childcare staff for Covid-19 vaccination: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/554316

Introduce weekly Covid-19 testing for school staff and students in England: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/550053

attributes.action: A complete overhaul of development planning guidelines .
attributes.background: Review and overhaul current residential planning guidelines to forcefully ensure greener and more sustainable development and communities across the country . End standardised repetitive new build housing developments that focus on profit only and minimise impact instead improving impact .
attributes.additional_details: Currently the construction industry particularly the new build housing sector developments are focused purely on developers profits . Often following standard designs that repeat across the country creating soulless hard landscaped developments with little to no thought to the natural environment . Focus should be on creating spaces that in balance and to improve the natural landscapes and utilising technology thats avaliable now . Individually designed spaces that will benefit the environment

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the UK Government or House of Commons to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about new developments currently being built, but it's not clear exactly what you want the Government to do about this.

We have published the following related petition, which you might like to sign:

Make it law for all new builds to include green energy solutions: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/332338

It's not clear how your request for new developments not to be based on standard designs could be implemented by the Government.

attributes.action: Replace usage of plastic bags for loose foods in supermarkets with paper ones.
attributes.background: To replace the usage of plastic bags with paper bags will help many shoppers become encourage to live a more sustainable lifestyle, due to being a simple step in reducing plastic waste and pollution. Many people are encourage to buy foods in plastic packaging - this could be a simple fix.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/328310

attributes.action: Rescue the Economy by creating Green Jobs and scrapping investment in Fossil
attributes.background:
The government should stimulate the economy and halt the destruction of our ecosystem by creating millions of jobs in clean energy and putting carbon emissions into structural decline.

The world only has 6 months left to change the course of the climate crisis, according to the IEA.
attributes.additional_details:
Covid-19 has seen millions thrown into unemployment and at this critical point for the survival of life on earth, we must not look backwards by funding the industries that are destroying it.

The IEA has also stated that targeting green jobs will be more effective than pouring money into the high-carbon economy. Their sustainably recovery plan sets out the potential of 1.9m jobs in building efficiency, 1.1m in wind and solar power, 0.86m in power networks and millions more in other areas.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/317343

attributes.action: Subsidise electric cars so that they become affordable and practical to use
attributes.background: Subsidise the production of electric road vehicles so they become as affordable as petrol-fuelled vehicles. Increase the number of electric car charging stations and invest in new battery technology so that the vehicles are practical to use.
attributes.additional_details:
Transport is a major source of greenhouse gas emissions in the UK. If we are to stand a chance against climate change, we need to cut greenhouse gas emissions to net-zero by 2025. 

At the moment, the demand for electric cars is low because they are impractical and unaffordable. Individuals will always make decisions that provide them with the highest amount of personal utility. It is the responsibility of the government to make sustainable choices within our interest.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

There is already a grant available for electric vehicles. You can find out more here:

https://www.gov.uk/plug-in-car-van-grants
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Provide Relief for Directors of Limited Companies and Other Self-Employed
attributes.background: Directors of Limited Companies, a model many self-employed people use, will be left out of the COVID19 self-employment scheme for the self-employed on a technicality. This leaves many of us with no idea where we'll be getting our next cheque.
attributes.additional_details:
On March 26, the government addressed the demands of the self-employed who had lost most of their business due to COVID19.

However, this left out nearly 2 million self-employed people: directors of limited companies who operate as their company's sole employee without PAYE.   Many creative professionals have been ignored by the government, with no work and no plan to support us during this time.

We ask that the government use our taxes from last year as a guide to sustain us during this time.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign these petitions calling for the same action.

Pay self employed workers a wage due to lack or earnings caused by COVID-19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/303345

Provide COVID19 income support for the newly self-employed, without HMRC records: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310471

Remove the £50k earnings limit for self-employed to access government funding: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310455

Coronavirus Support Package for Directors / Shareholders of small Limited Co's: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310515

Get HMRC to refund the Self-Employed their Jan 2020 1st Tax Payment on Account: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/304995

Bring forward COVID-19 Self-employment grants to April 2020: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310898

You can find out about what Government support is available for people as a result of coronavirus (under the section on employment and financial support) here: https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus


You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.

Find out more and watch the Committee put questions suggested by petitioners to Government Ministers and the Deputy Chief Medical Officer: https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/326/petitions-committee/news/145767/committee-question-deputy-chief-medical-officer-and-ministers-on-coronavirus-response/

Read correspondence with Government Ministers asking further questions: https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/326/petitions-committee/publications/3/correspondence/

This puts their families and other commuters at risk.
attributes.additional_details: Close non essential construction sites with some form of pay similar to other jobs who have had to close

attributes.background: Due to fall and risk to the UK public in times of need and distress,  we need to stimulate economic growth allow money to flow and circulate around the economy will prevent a recession or even a possible recession, with people benefiting from the uv light and boosting morale in a difficult time.
attributes.additional_details:
Stimulate the economy with extra source of employment.
Allow funding for start ups
Legalise commercial and private cultivation with a prison of a easily obtainable licence
Government incentive
Increase and sustain gdp through exports and UK trade
I believe in a time of need can help in many ways not just to deal with things, but bring us the public closer to the planet which we have distanced from. Cannabis has many health benefits and properties and I feel it unlawful for us not to explore this

attributes.action: Subject all mature trees to Tree Preservation Orders.
attributes.background: We need protection of all mature trees, as afforded to those in conservation areas, ensured in response to the Government declared Climate Emergency 1st May 2019. Mature trees are being removed without environmentally commensurate replacement, and with the life sustained by the tree already lost.
attributes.additional_details:
Trees store carbon and give us oxygen, vital for life. 
They provide habitat for wildlife and support biodiversity. 
In urban areas they reduce noise and capture pollutants from the air we breathe. They provide soil stability and reduce stormwater runoff, crucial for flood management. Trees provide shelter from wind and sun, and actively cool the surrounding air as well as enhancing our lives, giving us a sense of beauty and well being.

The right time to plant a tree is many decades ago.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300050

attributes.action: Remove international students from net migration statistics.
attributes.background: Please stop classifying international students as 'immigrants' and making policies based on this limited view. Design a creative policy that encourages the most talented students to choose the UK & through which Britain's international graduates can solve for our critical skills & labour shortages.
attributes.additional_details:
By design, international students are in the UK temporarily, for a limited period of time. How, therefore, are they immigrants? 

International students make a net positive contribution of at least £26 billion per year to the UK & are the source of almost 70% of our education export earnings. They sustain jobs all over the country. In many ways they subsidise the world-leading research that goes in British universities. They further ties of trade and culture, going back as friends of the UK.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about immigration arrangements regarding international students, but we're not sure exactly what changes you'd like the Government or Parliament to make to these arrangements. Your petition calls for "a creative policy that encourages the most talented students to choose the UK", but it's not clear what you want this to look like.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Action to address soaring energy costs, consumption and supply issues.
attributes.background:
1) Review the need for the street lights between 9pm and 6am. Pass any savings on to domestic dwellings, and reduce light pollution too.

2) Pump prime renewable energies.  Nationalise the manufacturing and fitting of modern solar harvesting roof tiles which look like normal roof tiles.
attributes.additional_details:
Re-opening coal reserves isn’t sustainable or environmentally friendly.

The governments plans, even if worst case scenario, for reduced commercial/industrial supply and even domestic blackouts should not be acceptable.

rejection.details:
Decisions about street lighting are a matter for individual local authorities, not the UK Government or Parliament.

We could accept a petition calling for the Government to take action in relation to the means of production of solar panels, or you might like to sign the following petitions, which makes a related request:

Address the Energy, Climate and Environment crisis by investing in Renewables: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/617729

Create new publicly owned solar energy company to address fuel & climate crisis: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/611416

attributes.action: Ban Gillnetters over 15m in Scottish waters
attributes.background: We want Government to recognise that gillnetting is one of the most destructive techniques of fishing in the world and we ask for a total ban on industrial gillnetters operating in Scottish waters
attributes.additional_details: Gillnetting kills enormous by-catch and destroys wildlife in a very cruel manner.It has a major negative impact on marine species and fish stocks. It destoy's our shores and beaches with plastic discard. Evidence of tons of discarded fishing gear by EU owned boats is being dredged up on a daily basis by local boats. Please support sustainable responsible fishing, fight to improve the environment and reduce wildlife cruelty caused on an idustrial scale by EU owned gillnetters

rejection.details:
Your petition is about something that the Scottish Government is responsible for. Specifically, the licensing of fishing vessels is the responsibility of Marine Scotland, a Scottish Government agency. This means that the UK Government and Parliament can't look into this issue.

The Scottish Parliament has its own Citizen Participation and Public Petitions Committee. If you'd like to send your petition to the Scottish Parliament, you can find out more here:

http://www.scottish.parliament.uk/gettinginvolved/petitions/index.aspx

attributes.action: Stop the overdevelopment of the blue lake in Northfleet, Kent.
attributes.background: The government should protect the local wildlife nature environment as it did for the Swanscombe Peninsula from greed and interests. https://www.kentonline.co.uk/gravesend/news/plans-to-infill-lake-with-thousands-of-homes-267302/?fbclid=IwAR2xqcj8sFJHobNfMvh22B_6hNF2zY7lG0wDfaeH6Veyx7MWYlNyLfdOBwQ
attributes.additional_details: Our natural habitat and environment is threatened daily by the increased level of pollutants we need to preserve the areas that have created a self sustaining natural environment home of many species of wildlife and plants that may not ve able to survive if their habitat is destroyed.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Local planning decisions are a matter for the relevant local authority, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Suspend major development applications on green belt and protected land: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/616891

attributes.action: Update KCSIE to protect children from peer on peer abuse to an absolute decree.
attributes.background: I think that KCSIE Must be updated in a way that ensures children are protected to a higher degree. Many more parts of KCSIE guidance must be changed so that schools cannot avoid taking steps within a child’s best personal interest (including DSLs, headteachers, SLT etc), unless it would cause harm.
attributes.additional_details: If a child has been a victim of peer on peer abuse (online, physical, sexual, or any other harm - perceived or real) there’s many things a school should do, but nothing they must do. Schools must be made to allow a child to make their own choices in regards to what happens after a report of violence (moving class, separated from the perpetrator). Those who uphold a sustained pattern of abuse should be looked at as candidates for expulsion (especially where they could harm other children)

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you're concerned about the action schools take in response to bullying, but we're not sure what changes you want to be made to the Government's statutory guidance on keeping children
safe in education, or what new requirements you want to be imposed on schools.

Section 89 of the Education and Inspections Act 2006 already provides that maintained schools must have measures to encourage good behaviour and prevent all forms of bullying amongst pupils, and the Education (Independent School Standards) Regulations 2014 provide that the proprietor of an Academy or other independent school ensures that bullying at the school is prevented in so far as reasonably practicable, by the drawing up and implementation of an effective anti-bullying strategy

You could start a new petition explaining more clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Reduce the fixed tax rate on petrol and diesel road fuels
attributes.background: With a tax on road fuels fixed at a high percentage of the retail pump price, road users are currently being forced to generate a huge windfall tax caused by the underlying rising cost of crude oil
attributes.additional_details: With the well publicised underlying rises in wholesale energy markets it seems entirely unfair to further penalise the general public by sustaining a fixed high percentage tax rate on road fuels when a historically acceptable tax take could be achieved whilst still helping cap the retail pump prices, assisting general economic activity

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599411

attributes.action: Ban non-recyclable plastic wrappers and coverings found in supermarkets.
attributes.background: Plastic packaging should be recyclable and  recyclable in all locations by funding more recycling bins. It should be possible to recycle ALL plastic packaging with home recycling bins. Greener alternatives should be encouraged with greater incentives/disincentives for businesses e.g. greater tax.
attributes.additional_details: Many packagings are either "not yet recycled" or "only recylable at large supermarkets". Action needs to be made to stop single use packaging in everyday domestic products that aren't recyclable. Recycling must be accessible from the home for every recyclable product to reduce landfill. Recycling is important to buffer environmental impacts and needs to be acted upon quickly as a step in long-term sustainability, whilst greater and more direct changes are made. Let's protect the UK environment!

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/603901

attributes.action: Introduce a vegan inclusive food wheel in schools when educating pupils on diet.
attributes.background: Remove dairy as a necessary food group as unless an infant, breast milk is not needed. A protein section instead of a meat only title, with vegan proteins included.
attributes.additional_details: I do not want my child to sit in a lesson where they are taught false information that their vegan diet is incorrect or incomplete. It is a viable and healthy choice that can sustain a human of any age therefore the food wheel should be inclusive for all diets not just meat eaters alone.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for specific teaching resources used by schools.

The NHS's eatwell gudie includes non-diary alternatives, which you can see here

https://www.nhs.uk/live-well/eat-well/the-eatwell-guide/

attributes.action: Stop the planting of non-native tree, shrub, and flowers on new housing estates.
attributes.background: Government should restrict the purchase & planting by new housing developments & home owners of non-native plants, trees & shrubs on highways, property & open spaces. In order to achieve net gains for biodiversity, native species such as bees and hedgehogs, would benefit by planting native flora.
attributes.additional_details: This will be essential in urban spaces, to provide key habitat for native fauna, assist in gains for biodiversity in the uk and more importantly, carbon drawdown. There will also be less management involved in maintaining natural, self sustaining trees and shrubs, which grow better to the uk climate, soils and do not create dead areas of vegetation build up, crowded and overgrown areas which require maintenance and are unsuitable for British fauna. This is fundamental to British biodiversity.

rejection.details: It is up to private housing developers and homeowners, rather than the Government or Parliament, to decide what kinds of plants they grow. You could start a petition asking the Government to dedicate a fund for local councils to grow native plants and increase native biodiversity.

attributes.action: Stop supply of plastic toothbrushes made from Polyethylene (non recycled)...
attributes.background: I would like the Government to ban or stop supply of plastic toothbrushes made from Code 4 polyethylene, which is not commercially recycled. Preventing the supply of more non-recyclable toothbrushes in the UK, will remove 4 million kilograms of plastic waste each year...
attributes.additional_details:
Over 200 million plastic toothbrushes are disposed of in the UK alone and last in landfills and oceans for over 500 years before decomposing. This means that every plastic toothbrush ever made, still exists now. Thankfully there are now several different types of more sustainable toothbrush alternatives available on the market today...

We have successfully banned supply of plastic straws, cotton buds and stirrers. Now let's take another successful step forward to sustainability in the UK.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about plastic toothbrushes, but it's not clear if you want the Government to ban the sale, manufacture or import, or all three, of these toothbrushes.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Make flying more sustainable - right now
attributes.background: Please accelerate the journey towards sustainable aviation by rapidly and immediately increasing the amount of sustainable aviation fuels (SAFs) used in the aviation sector. Specifically, SAFs which don't compete with food production or cause deforestation, and which are not sourced from animals.
attributes.additional_details:
SAFs are made from CO2 & water. They cost more than fossil fuels, so demand & production are low. To make flying less harmful, we must start replacing fossil fuel:

The public sector should pay for SAFs when booking flights, e.g. using Compensaid

Aircraft operators should have to buy growing percentages of SAFs, at first covering the 1st class’ share of fuel, then business, eventually applying to all fares (and cargo / charters). 

Fossil fuel should be taxed until it becomes the pricier option

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about the sustainability of flying, and want the use of sustainable aviation fuels to increase, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Increase Air Passenger Duty and introduce taxes for aviation fuel: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/574630

Impose legal limits on non-essential flying for everyone: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/584120

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do. For example, we could accept a petition calling for taxes on non-sustainable aviation fuel, or reduced Air Passenger Duty for flights where sustainable aviation fuel is used.

attributes.action: Stop subsidising the fishing industry with taxpayers money.
attributes.background: Stop subsidising fishing trade and focus the taxpayers money on conserving our oceans and its wildlife..
attributes.additional_details: The statistics are plain to see, not just overfishing and plastic waste in our oceans from discarded fishing equipment, but the humanitarian crisis in the Asian fishing trade and the piracy in African waters. So called marine charities that are supposed to be regulating safe and sustainable fishing only exist to profit from the mass fishing in the first place! If the fishing industry cant support itself then its obviously time for the industry to die, just as you allowed with the coal industry.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/581530
